title.narrative: Energy Sector Cleanup and Land Reclamation Project

description.narrative: CLRP's objectives are to: (a) address environmental legacy issues related to open dumping of ashes on land from KEK's Kosovo A thermal power plant; (b) enable KEK to free land for community development purposes currently taken by overburden material and to enableKEK to remediate the Kosovo A Ash Dump; and (c) support KEK and MESP to implement continued clean-up operations and environmental good practices in the mining and energy sector.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.3 | Description :The Recipient, through the MESP PMU, shall retain the panel of experts,satisfactory to the Association, pursuant to part F of the Project. | Due Date :31-Oct-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.D.4 | Description :MESP shall be responsible for implementation of the Resettlement ActionPlan and shall ensure that resettlement for the Shala neighorhood of Hade village is undertaken in accordance with the provisionsand procedures contained in the approved RAP | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, 5 | Description :Prior to the start of any civil works, UNMIK shall ensure that KEKshall carry out an environmental impact assessment of componentsA, B & C. | Due Date :30-Jun-2008

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, 6 | Description :Prior to the start of any civil works, UNMIK shall ensure that KEK,will have an EMP prepared to eliminate, offset, or reduce to acceptable levels any adverse environmental & social aspects. | DueDate :30-Jun-2008

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, 7 (i) | Description :UNMIK shall ensure that KEK implements the EMPs & the OperationsManual in accordance with their respective terms, & applies & implents the policies & procedures. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, 9 | Description :Without IDA's prior written consent, UNMIK & KEK shall not make anyfinal decision on the use of land reclaimed, or sell, transfer, lease or dispose of without a land use plan. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, section I.A.4. | Description :A stakeholder review and monitoring committee will be establishedunder the Project to oversee the progress and results of Component F of the Additional Financing, in particular the ESIA. Thecommittee will be chaired by the MESP and consist of representatives ofthe Ministry of Economic Development, Ministry of Finance,KEK and the municipality of Obiliq. | Due Date :31-Oct-2013

title.narrative: Reduction of houses at risk from geotechnical instabilities of Kosovo A ash dump

target.value: No houses at risk since 2010, target achieved

title.narrative: Preparation of full site clean-up investment plan and adaptation of health and safety regulations and low-cost remediation program

target.value: Prepared site clean-up investment plan and adaption of health and safety regulations and low-cost remediation plan

actual.value: Prepared site clean-up investment plan and adaption of health and safety regulations and low-cost remediation plan

title.narrative: Percentage of ash disposal that complies with environmental good practice and is redirected from open dumping on the Kosovo A Dump t o the Mirsh mine.
Tons of found tar deposits from the gasification site safely removed and disposed
Tons of found phenol in water solutions from the gasification site safely removed and treated
Contaminated land managed or dump sites closed under the project
All found priority hazardous substances from the gasfication site safely removed and treated/disposed (tars, benzene, phenols, metha nol, oily compounds
Tons of found tar sludge, benzene, methanol and oily compunds from the gasification site safely removed and disposed
Remediation of Kosovo A Ash Dump, eliminating dust problems and pollution infiltration from the ashes into groundwater
Increase capacities in KEK for continued clean-up operations as measured by the number of hectares remediated and reclaimed with KEK 's own resources
Mirah Mine prepared for sanitary disposal of Kosovo A ash

baseline.value: Mirah Mine prepared for sanitary disposal of Kosovo A Ash

target.value: Mirah Mine prepared for sanitary disposal of Kosovo A Ash

actual.value: Mirash mine prepared for sanitary disposal of Kosovo A Ash

title.narrative: Increase capacities in MESP for environmental good practices in the mining and energy sector

baseline.value: No ESIA for KPP prepared. Resettlement for Shala neighborhood of Hade village not yet completed in line with approved RAP

target.value: ESIA for KPP prepared and disseminated in line with Bank's policies and good international practices. Resettlement of ShalaNeighborhood of Hade village completed in line with approved RAP

actual.value: Scoping report for the Environmental and Social Impact Assessment disclosed and discussed at public consultations on October 16,2014. Draft ESIA received, revised but undergoing further revisions to social/mining and air quality section. Resettlement forShala neighborhood ongoing with 15 completed houses from 22 under construction and 12 families who have moved to new Shkabaj/Hade

title.narrative: Environmental and Social baseline data available for ESIA

target.value: Environmental and Social Baseline Date available for the ESIA

actual.value: Baseline data are available for Environmental and Social Impact Assessment
Low carbon strategy has been prepared

title.narrative: Land reclaimed for natural habitats, agriculture or other land use purposes in KEK's overburden areas (Hectare (Ha), Custom)
